technologies.name: React
technologies.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications with reusable components.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, enabling server-side scripting with JavaScript.

technologies.name: Java
technologies.description: A versatile, platform-independent programming language known for its stability, scalability, and widespread use in enterprise environments.

technologies.name: HTML5
technologies.description: The latest version of the HyperText Markup Language, essential for creating modern web pages with improved multimedia support and semantic elements.

technologies.name: CSS3
technologies.description: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML, enabling responsive and visually appealing web design.

technologies.name: Database
technologies.description: A structured collection of data stored electronically, facilitating efficient data retrieval, manipulation, and management.

technologies.name: AWS
technologies.description: Amazon Web Services, a comprehensive cloud computing platform offering services like compute power, storage, and databases, among others.

technologies.name: Salesforce
technologies.description: A leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that helps businesses manage their sales, customer service, and marketing efforts.

technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.description: A high-level programming language used primarily for building interactive and dynamic websites. It is the core language for web development alongside HTML and CSS.

technologies.name: GitHub
technologies.description: A cloud-based platform for version control and collaborative development, enabling developers to share and manage code repositories with team members.
